org.bukkit.attributes

Interface AttributeModifier


  • public interface AttributeModifier
     A numerical transformation that can be applied to the values of Attributes.
 Modifiers are identified by their UUID, and two modifiers with the same UUID will
 always be considered the same modifier, regardless of whether their other properties
 match.

 AttributeModifiers can be created through the AttributeFactory,
 which is provided by Server.getAttributeFactory().

 An AttributeModifier has a value and an AttributeModifier.Operation used to combine
 that value with the prior value of the Attribute. There are three operations
 available:

    AttributeModifier.Operation.ADD - add the modifier's value
    AttributeModifier.Operation.BASE - add the current value multiplied by the modifier's value
    AttributeModifier.Operation.MULTIPLY - multiply by the modifier's value

 The operations are applied in the above order, but for each operation, all of its
 modifiers are applied simultaneously. So, all modifiers are applied in three big
 operations, like this:

 X <- A1 + A2 + A3 + ...
 X <- (B1 * X) + (B2 * X) + (B3 * X) + ...
 X <- X * M1 * M2 * M3 ...

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        A human-readable name or description for this modifier. This has no functional purpose, it exists only for debugging.

      • getId

        UUID getId()
        Globally unique identifier for this modifier. Two modifiers with the same UUID will be considered the same modifier in every sense.

      • getValue

        double getValue()
        The value of this modifier

      • getOperation

        AttributeModifier.Operation getOperation()
        The numerical operation applied by this modifier
